Class User

java.lang.Object
User
Direct Known Subclasses:
Applicant, HDBManager
public class User extends Object
The User class serves as a superclass for all user types in the system, including Applicants, HDB Officers, and HDB Managers.

It encapsulates common attributes such as name, NRIC, age, marital status, password, and role. It also provides basic user operations like login and password change.

  • Constructor Details

    • User

      public User(String nric, String pwd, String role)
      Constructs a User with only NRIC, password, and role. Used typically during login before full user data is loaded.
      Parameters:
      nric - the NRIC of the user
      pwd - the password
      role - the role of the user (e.g., "applicant", "hdbofficer", "hdbmanager")

    • User

      public User(String nric, String pwd, String role, HashMap<String, List<String>> correct_map)
      Constructs a fully initialized User using details from a role-specific map. Called when creating subclasses such as Applicant, HDBOfficer, or HDBManager.
      Parameters:
      nric - the NRIC of the user
      pwd - the password
      role - the role of the user
      correct_map - the map containing user details for the specific role

  • Method Details

    • get_name

      public String get_name()
      Returns:
      the user's name

    • get_nric

      public String get_nric()
      Returns:
      the user's NRIC

    • get_age

      public int get_age()
      Returns:
      the user's age

    • get_marital_stat

      public boolean get_marital_stat()
      Returns:
      true if the user is married, false otherwise

    • get_password

      public String get_password()
      Returns:
      the user's password

    • get_role

      public String get_role()
      Returns:
      the user's role

    • login

      public boolean login(HashMap<String, HashMap<String, List<String>>> all_data)
      Verifies the login credentials against the provided dataset.
      Parameters:
      all_data - a combined map of all user roles with their respective data
      Returns:
      true if the credentials are correct, false otherwise

    • change_pwd

      public void change_pwd(HashMap<String, List<String>> exact_map, String new_pwd)
      Changes the password of the user and updates it in the provided user data map. This should be called only after successful login.
      Parameters:
      exact_map - the specific map (role-based) where the user data is stored
      new_pwd - the new password to be set
